text:
Hello everyone!! This is Prasidh, a third year undergrad, and am looking to contribute to ReinforcementLearning.jl, I am familiar with Q learning and its implementations in Pytorch and am working on getting familiar with the codebase and the workflow and looking to make my first contribution on the default implementation of double DQN issue.

I am looking to learn more and contribute in adding more RL algorithms to the to the repo.

I am a bit familiar with Julia and have read the articles in the Get Started section of the docs and have a good understanding, at this point and know what changes has to be made to solve the issue.

But I find the implementations in the ReinforcementLearningZoo.jl source code a bit hard to wrap my mind around and I am also finding it difficult to debug and test the code.

It would be great if I could have a coding session with someone so that I can get in speed with ReinforcementLearningZoo.jl repo, and start contributing.

Thanks in advance.

Hello everyone!! This is Prasidh, a third year undergrad, and am looking to contribute to ReinforcementLearning.jl, I am familiar with Q learning and its implementations in Pytorch and am working on getting familiar with the codebase and the workflow and looking to make my first contribution on the default implementation of double DQN issue.

I am looking to learn more and contribute in adding more RL algorithms to the to the repo.

I am a bit familiar with Julia and have read the articles in the Get Started section of the docs and have a good understanding, at this point and know what changes has to be made to solve the issue.

But I find the implementations in the ReinforcementLearningZoo.jl source code a bit hard to wrap my mind around and I am also finding it difficult to debug and test the code.

It would be great if I could have a coding session with someone so that I can get in speed with ReinforcementLearningZoo.jl repo, and start contributing.

Thanks in advance.

text: Usually I'll clone dependencies to a local workspace. Then create a separate folder and run `] activate .` there and `] dev /path/to/RLZoo` or other dependencies. After that I'll create a Jupyter notebook (with Revise.jl properly setup) to experiment with new algorithms or fix bugs.

elements.text: Usually I'll clone dependencies to a local workspace. Then create a separate folder and run `] activate .` there and `] dev /path/to/RLZoo` or other dependencies. After that I'll create a Jupyter notebook (with Revise.jl properly setup) to experiment with new algorithms or fix bugs.
